item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I prayed all the way up that hill yesterday, he said softly. Not for you to stay; I didna think that would be right. I prayed I'd be strong enough to send ye away. He shook his head, still gazing up the hill, a faraway look in his eyes. I said 'Lord, if I've never had courage in my life before, let me have it now. Let me be brave enough not to fall on my knees and beg her to stay.' He pulled his eyes away from the cottage and smiled briefly at me. Hardest thing I ever did, Sassenach." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "42 is a nice number that you can take home and introduce to your family." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The first thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Reality is frequently inaccurate." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Does the walker choose the path, or the path the walker?" -- Garth Nix

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description: "There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "A true friend is the one who holds your hand and touches your heart" -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Winter is coming." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "If you try and take a cat apart to see how it works, the first thing you have on your hands is a non-working cat." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Arthur Brisbane
item.description: "A good friend can tell you what is the matter with you in a minute. He may not seem such a good friend after telling. " -- Arthur Brisbane

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Margaret Lee Runbeck
item.description: "Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts." -- Margaret Lee Runbeck

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up. You build up all these defenses, you build up a whole suit of armor, so that nothing can hurt you, then one stupid person, no different from any other stupid person, wanders into your stupid life...You give them a piece of you. They didn't ask for it. They did something dumb one day, like kiss you or smile at you, and then your life isn't your own anymore. Love takes hostages. It gets inside you. It eats you out and leaves you crying in the darkness, so simple a phrase like 'maybe we should be just friends' turns into a glass splinter working its way into your heart. It hurts. Not just in the imagination. Not just in the mind. It's a soul-hurt, a real gets-inside-you-and-rips-you-apart pain. I hate love." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Maura Woika add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman
